text:
Ms. [**Known lastname 12641**] is a 45 year old female with past medical history
   significant for discoid lupus, anorexia/bulimia who was admitted
   [**2168-3-15**] to [**Hospital 680**] Hospital with lethargy and jaundice. Father called
   EMS after seeing her jaundice and the patient was not speaking clearly
   to him and was complaining of weakness, joint aches and malaise.
   Patient unable to provide full history but per OSH notes and reports
   from her father she was very socially withdrawn for past few months and
   has refused to let family and her boyfriend visit her all but a few
   times. Father was not sure whether patient has been abusing laxatives
   or using recent drugs or alcohol.
   .
   At OSH, she presented with extreme lethargy, coffee ground emesis and
   additional melanotic stools. She was seen by GI and placed on
   Octreotide drip, IV PPI, and abdominal US showed ascites and portal HTN
   but no GB stones and common bile duct was normal size.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 76**])
   Assessment:
    Pr remains on a/c 40/600/20/5 sats 100%. Lungs course throughout, pt
   suctioned for small amounts of  billious looking secreations
   Action:
   Abg at 1430 7.49/18/127
   Response:
   Slight improvement in bicarb
   Plan:
   No plans for further vent changes
   Pr remains fluid positive
   Hepatorenal syndrome
   Assessment:
   Pt continues with ecteric urine between 30-80 cc hr
   Action:
    Pt had ivf which have finished and no plans for more fluids since  pt
   is 3liter pos
   Response:
   Will follow urine output
   Plan:
   Will start lactolose today
   Tube feeds  will start when we have  recommendation from nutrition
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt
s mental status remains altered,  this am pt truning lt should in
   posteruing on lt side. with bibinisky on lt leg pupils 3-4 mm [**Doctor Last Name **],
   Action:
   Pt sent for head ct, and pr continues to get q2 neuro checks, propofol
   drip stopped at 10 am
   Response:
   No significant findings on am ct. pt more alert does not follow
   commands, grimmas to pain
   Plan:
   Continue with neuro checks q2
   Will restart lactolose this afternoon
   Alteration in Nutrition
   Assessment:
   Pt has been npo  since admission
   Action:
   Pedi feeding tube placed this afternoon, will have chest xray to
   confirm
   Response:
   Awaiting chest xray
   Plan:
   Will start tube feeds this afternoon when  feeding tube confirmed
   .H/O gastric Varices / Portal Hypertensive Gastropathy
   Assessment:
   Pt  has no signs of bleeding pt remains on octerotide  drip until1800
   Action:
   Pt has hct checked at 1430
   Response:
   Hct 25 no signs of bleeding
   Plan:
   Will need  repeat hct at 10 pm
